intro: Tetragonanthus inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal tetragonanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its quadrangular stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
